conbody.p: Phone's are the main unit of an IPA transcription. They are composed of a vowel or consonant along with optional length, prefix, suffix, tone, and combining diacritics. The following sections outline each part of a single Phone.

section.title: Base Phone
section.p: The base phone may be any IPA vowel or consonant.

section.title: Prefix Diacritic
section.p: Prefix diacritics appear before the Base Phone.

section.title: Combining Diacritic
section.p: Combining diacritics must appear directly after the base phone.

section.title: Length
section.p: Phone length is indicated using character 0x02D0 (long) and 0x02D1 (half-long.) Up to three long diacritics may be appended to a

section.title: Suffix Diacritic
section.p: Suffix diacritics appear after the base phone and length if applicable.
